comments.creator: limi@mozilla.com
comments.author: limi@mozilla.com
comments.text:
According to our own Chris Finke:

> The top 17 TLD typos are all variations of .com. 
> In order of frequency:

> .com\, .ocm, .con, .cmo, .copm, .xom, ".com,", 
> .vom, .comn, .com', ".co,", .comj, .coim, .cpm, 
> .colm, .conm, and .coom.

We should correct these just like we attempt to fix some other common URL entry mistakes, seeing as none of these are valid TLDs — although they may become so in the future, but we can keep tabs on that.

We should correct these just like we attempt to fix some other common URL entry mistakes, seeing as none of these are valid TLDs — although they may become so in the future, but we can keep tabs on that.

comments.text: "our own" meaning "part of our community", sorry about the imprecision. :)

comments.raw_text:
Alright, I positively love this feature. I type .cpm so much....

And to top it off, I've got a domain hijacker search engine.

comments.creator: alex@moreati.org.uk
comments.text: Such typos are at least partially covered. At least .vom, .xom, .cpm, and .prg are corrected. I presume by https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/ed2fc6bdcef6fe27b5588aa5d5891f6792708d09/docshell/base/URIFixup.jsm#683-698. I happened to stumble on the behaviour in Firefox desktop 84.0.2 on Linux https://twitter.com/moreati/status/1353306016713240576
